summary: A wheelchair-bound photographer spies on his neighbors from his apartment window and becomes convinced one of them has committed murder.
synopsis: Professional photographer L.B. "Jeff" Jefferies breaks his leg while getting an action shot at an auto race. Confined to his New York apartment, he spends his time looking out of the rear window observing the neighbors. He begins to suspect that a man across the courtyard may have murdered his wife. Jeff enlists the help of his high society fashion-consultant girlfriend Lisa Freemont and his visiting nurse Stella to investigate.
trivia: Based on the photo on Jeff's (James Stewart's) wall, Doyle (Wendell Corey) and Jeff flew a de Havilland Mosquito photo reconnaissance plane in World War II. Doyle would have been the pilot, and Jeff would have been the photographer and navigator. The airplane in the background behind Doyle and Jeff appears to be a P-38 Lightning.
